trans-unit.source: Pivot and unpivot data in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Pivot and unpivot data in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for pivoting and unpivoting data in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for pivoting and unpivoting data in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: You can pivot data in SQL Data Warehouse by using a CASE statement.
trans-unit.target: You can pivot data in SQL Data Warehouse by using a CASE statement.

trans-unit.source: This article contains two simple examples on how to both pivot and unpivot a table without using the pivot and unpivot syntax found in SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: This article contains two simple examples on how to both pivot and unpivot a table without using the pivot and unpivot syntax found in SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Unpivoting is a little bit more complex.
trans-unit.target: Unpivoting is a little bit more complex.

trans-unit.source: However, it is still very achievable using CASE.
trans-unit.target: However, it is still very achievable using CASE.

trans-unit.source: For this you will also need to first determine how many columns you are going to unpivot.
trans-unit.target: For this you will also need to first determine how many columns you are going to unpivot.

trans-unit.source: In the previous example we pivoted four columns.
trans-unit.target: In the previous example we pivoted four columns.

trans-unit.source: To perform the Unpivot we will need to amplify the dataset temporarily by a factor of 4.
trans-unit.target: To perform the Unpivot we will need to amplify the dataset temporarily by a factor of 4.

trans-unit.source: This results in a two step process:
trans-unit.target: This results in a two step process:

trans-unit.source: Firstly, create a temporary table containing four rows.
trans-unit.target: Firstly, create a temporary table containing four rows.

trans-unit.source: We will use this to amplify the data:
trans-unit.target: We will use this to amplify the data:

trans-unit.source: The second step is to use CASE to conditionally unpivot the data back converting the set back into rows.
trans-unit.target: The second step is to use CASE to conditionally unpivot the data back converting the set back into rows.

trans-unit.source: To achieve this we will need to create a cartesian product of by joining to the temporary taable #Nmbr created in the first step:
trans-unit.target: To achieve this we will need to create a cartesian product of by joining to the temporary taable #Nmbr created in the first step:

trans-unit.source: Finally don't forget to clean up by dropping the temporary table.
trans-unit.target: Finally don't forget to clean up by dropping the temporary table.
